conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature.
Identify given information: State A temperature, pressure, and volume; State B pressure and volume.
Assume the gas behaves ideally, so the ideal gas law PV = nRT holds.
Express the ideal gas law for states A and B.
Set up the ratio of the two equations to eliminate nR.
Substitute the known values into the equation.
The temperature of the gas at state B is 900 K.
